EE02.name: Integrated marine and inland water management

area: Integrated marine and inland water management

GR02.name: Integrated marine and inland water management

area: Integrated marine and inland water management

LT02.name: Integrated marine and inland water management

area: Integrated marine and inland water management

news.title: Malta is surrounded by water, but can’t get enough of it
news.summary: How can an island in the middle of the ocean get enough fresh water? By taking good care of the scarce amount of water that nature provides.

area: Integrated marine and inland water management

news.title: Diving into the sea of knowledge with 'SOPHIA'
news.summary: A great network of knowledge has emerged in Portugal, and the aim is to protect the country’s 4 million square kilometres of sea territory.

news.title: Improving the monitoring of Portuguese marine waters
news.summary: A research vessel with marine surveying equipment aimed at improving the management of Portuguese marine and coastal water has arrived in Lisbon.

news.title: The butterflies that disappeared
news.summary: Fluttering butterflies and chasing foxes used to be the normal scenario in the wetlands outside Ljubljana. This is the story of how the butterflies vanished, and of the struggle to bring them back to Slovenia’s marshlands.

news.title: Developing young environmentalists
news.summary: “We teach children and young people how to take care of nature so that they will take responsibility for the environment when they grow up”, says project manager Joanna Handziak-Buczko from Wrocław in Poland.

news.title: Explaining the importance of biodiversity
news.summary: Supported by Iceland, Liechtenstein and Norway, a project in Poland uses cartoons to educate young children about the importance of biodiversity.

news.title: Maintaining biodiversity
news.summary: In Lithuania wind power plants are fast becoming a meaningful source of energy. Despite their attractiveness because of their low carbon emissions, wind power plants have some direct negative impacts on biodiversity.

news.title: From asbestos to biodiversity
news.summary: In the heart of the Troodos National Forest Park, an abandoned asbestos mine poses a threat to people, fauna and wildlife alike. With support from the Grants, biodiversity protection and good management practices are being emphasised in the rehabilitation of the mining area.

CZ02.name: Biodiversity and Ecosystem Services & Environmental Monitoring and Integrated Planning Control & Adaptation to Climate Change

area: Environmental monitoring and integrated planning and control

CZ02.name: Biodiversity and Ecosystem Services & Environmental Monitoring and Integrated Planning Control & Adaptation to Climate Change

area: Environmental monitoring and integrated planning and control

Environmental monitoring and integrated planning and control

Environmental monitoring and integrated planning and control
Environmental monitoring and integrated planning and control

RO03.name: Environmental Monitoring and Integrated Planning and Control

news.title: How can your house save you money?
news.summary: A campaign supported through the EEA Grants in Poland invites people to take a closer look at the benefits of energy efficiency

PL04.name: Saving energy and promoting renewable energy source
Saving energy and promoting renewable energy source

news.title: Utilising the geothermal potential in Romania
news.summary: In Oradea in western Romania there is great potential to increase the use of geothermal energy. With support from the Grants and in cooperation with Icelandic Geothermal Engineering, the municipality is replacing fossil fuels for district heating.

news.title: An award-winning climate change project
news.summary: “Every week we are invited to either television or radio to talk about climate change adaptation. People are starting to see the effects on a daily basis. Now society needs to act,” says project leader Gil Penha-Lopes.

news.title: Increasing interest in climate change
news.summary: How do you get students more interested in learning about climate change? Portuguese teachers are using video, pictures and social media when teaching this important topic.

SK02.name: Adapation to Climate Change - Flood and Drought Prevention

news.title: “If a storm hits us, we need to have a plan”
news.summary: This is a story about how a storm upended a society, ultimately forcing Estonians to take action and protect themselves.

EE02.name: Integrated marine and inland water management

news.title: Understanding the impacts of climate change in Hungary
news.summary: Climate change is happening and decision-makers must know what society needs to prepare for. For that purpose, a new database with information on impacts and sectoral vulnerability to climate change in Hungary will soon be available.

CZ02.name: Biodiversity and Ecosystem Services & Environmental Monitoring and Integrated Planning Control & Adaptation to Climate Change

area: Environmental and climate change-related research and technology

news.title: More efficient and sustainable tunnels
news.summary: With support through the EEA Grants, Spain and Norway are working together to develop solutions to improve energy efficiency in tunnels. By taking the appropriate measures, electricity bill savings may reach 50%.

news.title: Eco-innovation in packaging
news.summary: “We estimate huge energy savings of around 125 000 GJ over three years and a reduction of 18 750 tonnes of CO2. That is the equivalent of emissions from 3 750 cars driven for one year,” said Felip Vidiella, EMEA and India Packaging R&D Director at Dow Spain.

ES02.name: Environmental and Climate Change-related Research and Technology

news.title: Equal opportunities for Roma students
news.summary: “We want to change the lives of our students and influence the rhetoric around Roma education.” This is how Zuzana Balážová of the Slovak Centre for Research of Ethnicity and Culture (CVEK) describes the ‘You also have a chance’ project.

news.title: Putting youth programmes at the heart of troubled communities
news.summary: The Slovak NGO KASPIAN has been working in Petržalka, the largest Slovak housing estate, for almost 20 years. Many of the children and young people in the area come from troubled backgrounds with high levels of deprivation.

news.title: Creating opportunities for the Roma
news.summary: In Slovakia, the unemployment rate among the Roma population is around 80 percent. In the eastern part of the country, Iceland, Liechtenstein and Norway are helping create employment opportunities for the Roma through ecological farming.

SK03.name: Funds for Non-governmental Organisations - Democracy and Human Rights

SK10.name: Funds for Non-governmental Organisations - Active citizenship and inclusion

news.title: NGO campaigning success against forced marriage
news.summary: Teenage forced marriage is a problem amongst the Romani population in Slovenia. An awareness campaign by Society Ključ has brought about an important change in the law, making forced marriages illegal.

news.title: A new play way for Ljubljana
news.summary: “Safety always comes first, and play is an integral part of a happy childhood. We are thankful that we got the opportunity to realise our idea and that we can now build on this foundation.”

news.title: I want my children to study
news.summary: “The project ‘A good start’ made it possible for me to go to work and support my girls, because my youngest daughter was enrolled in preschool,” says Maria.

news.title: The crucial investments in children
news.summary: Daniela is five years old. Every morning when she wakes up, the first thing she thinks of is preschool and her favourite teacher Carmen.

news.title: Romanian and Norwegian students rise to green challenge
news.summary: Through the ‘Greenovation Challenge’ schools project, Romanian and Norwegian students have been working together to tackle environmental problems.

news.title: Putting human rights in the spotlight
news.summary: With support through the EEA Grants, a Romanian NGO is working to protect the rights of people with disabilities, living in psychiatric wards, hospitals and specialised social care institutions in Romania.

news.title: ‘Intolerance affects you too’
news.summary: Twenty-five volunteers, 20 local government institutions, 10 NGOs, one goal – promoting tolerance in different communities across Romania. Project assistant, Andreea Tătaru, tells us about the vision and achievements of the anti-discrimination campaign.

news.title: Creating a civic spirit
news.summary: “We hope our initiative will help to create a civic spirit in Cojocna and serve as an example for other cities around Romania,” says Sorina Untu, Good Governance Officer for the ActiveWatch.

news.title: Increasing the capacity of Romanian NGOs
news.summary: “Each NGO must find its own way, but by offering our know-how in volunteer management we hope to give them a clearer idea of how to organise volunteer activities more effectively,” says Nicoleta Chis-Racolta, Director at Cluj-Napoca Volunteer Centre.

news.title: Improving trust through education
news.summary: “Both children and parents alike get to know each other through the project. This creates a stronger sense of trust within the local community,” says Andrei Dinu from the Romano ButiQ Association.

news.title: Supporting more active neighbourhoods in Bucharest
news.summary: “Our activities help create life in public spaces, foster interaction between people, and give something back to the local community,” says Miruna Tîrcă, President of the Komunitas Association.

news.title: Improving the quality of life for patients with incurable illnesses
news.summary: “After my breast cancer surgery I was just sent home and asked to relax. Here at the hospice, I receive the treatment and therapy I need to recover properly,” says Manuela, one of the patients at the Hospice Casa Sperantei in Bucharest.

news.title: Providing justice for Roma Holocaust victims
news.summary: “We lived under terrible living conditions and suffered a lot. People were dying from hunger, malnutrition and diseases,” says Gheorghe Manole, a Roma survivor of the deportations that took place in Romania during the Second World War.

news.title: A beautiful thing happened when these women were given power
news.summary: They come from a minority with no voice. Within this community they dared to raise their voices and create something for themselves.

news.title: Improving quality of life for people with disabilities
news.summary: Lithuania has undergone enormous changes over the last 25 years, yet families with children who have learning disabilities still require considerable support in order to be able to integrate their child into their family and community.

news.title: See the person, not the disability
news.summary: ‘See the person, not the disability’ - this is the message of the ‘I AM HERE’ project which is helping to address the isolation often experienced by people with learning disabilities and their families.

news.title: Discovering Jewish heritage through language
news.summary: The idea behind the ‘Bagel Shop’ tolerance campaign in Lithuania is to welcome the wider public into the Jewish community. Our colleagues in Human Rights Monitoring Institute went to meet students in a Hebrew language class to find out more.

news.title: Giving women a voice
news.summary: A project carried out under the Lithuanian NGO programme aims at bolstering civil society in the country by strengthening the advocacy work of women.

news.title: Improving services for hearing impaired children and their families
news.summary: The provision of basic services to children with impaired hearing and their families is lacking in Lithuania. With support from Iceland, Liechtenstein and Norway, a Lithuanian NGO is working to change this situation.

news.title: Encouraging civic participation in Lithuania
news.summary: The Lithuanian NGO ‘School of Success’ works to increase civic participation in the country by engaging with pupils.

news.title: Mainstreaming LGBT equality in Lithuania
news.summary: Through the Lithuanian NGO Fund, Iceland, Liechtenstein and Norway are supporting efforts to promote the rights of LGBT people in the country.

news.title: Improving information provision for people with disabilities
news.summary: “A wheelchair is only a different way of moving around,” says Audrius Kalvėnas. He is working with the Lithuanian Union of Persons with Disabilities to help improve the lives of people with reduced mobility.

news.title: Protecting Whistleblowers in Lithuania
news.summary: “There is no better way to encourage citizen to engage in anti-corruption than to ensure that they can report it safely,” says Sergejus Muravjovas, Executive Director of Transparency International Lithuania.

news.title: ‘Viltis’ – integrating people with mental disabilities
news.summary: “I am extremely grateful for having Amelia as a part of my life. Life would be meaningless without her,” says Neringa Bulotaite a member of ‘Viltis’ – a Lithuanian NGO working for the rights of children with mental disabilities.

news.title: Finding a way out of the darkness
news.summary: “I have started to think about tomorrow and the future,” says Svajūnas, a drug addict for more than 20 years, receiving help through a project supported by Iceland, Liechtenstein and Norway under the NGO programme in Lithuania.

news.title: Reducing food waste while helping the needy
news.summary: “By volunteering with Stop Food Waste in Lithuania, I get to work with other great volunteers, while contributing to social justice,” says Daiva Petelienė. She is one of the volunteers working with a project supported by the Lithuanian NGO Fund that aims to reduce food waste.

news.title: Fighting xenophobia with unconventional means
news.summary: There are many ways of fighting xenophobia - 'fear towards foreigners'. Youngsters involved in a project supported by the Lithuanian NGO fund decided to tackle the issue in a rather unconventional way; namely through the act of eating porridge.

news.title: Encouraging organ donation in Lithuania
news.summary: Rimvydas Vekerotas has his own very personal reasons for encouraging Lithuanian youngsters to become organ donors as part of a project supported by the Grants.  Seven years ago, his life was saved by a donor heart.

news.title: Promoting human rights through fairy tales
news.summary: The EEA Grants featured recently in the Malta Independent Online - a daily newspaper published in Malta. The article (reproduced below) tells the story of an EEA Grants supported project promoting human rights through cartoons.

news.title: Helping Polish victims of domestic and gender-based violence
news.summary: “Just the fact that we are here and getting counselling organised by the Feminoteka Foundation proves that we are thinking about our future,” says Beata, a Polish victim of gender-based violence.

news.title: Raising HIV awareness in Poland
news.summary: People living with HIV often face prejudice and discrimination in their daily lives. With support from Iceland, Liechtenstein and Norway through the Polish 'NGO programme', the 'HIVocrisy. Let’s Cure It' campaign aims to change that.

news.title: Breaking down language barriers
news.summary: Starting at a new school can be difficult - especially when you do not speak the language. The 'Polish Phrasebook' project supported by Iceland, Liechtenstein and Norway through the Polish 'NGO programme' aims to help students through the new experience.

news.title: Engaging Polish senior citizens
news.summary: “We believe it is important for senior citizens to help shape future services. Senior Citizen Councils can be a platform for senior citizens to make themselves heard,” says Beata Tokarz-Kamińska from the Association of Creative Initiatives “ę”.

news.title: Standing up against hate speech in Poland
news.summary: “In 5 years, I would like the walls in Poland to be clean and to create a trend that shows people that hate speech and intolerance are not acceptable,” says Joanna Grabarczyk, the project coordinator of the Hate Stop campaign of the Polska Association.

news.title: Creative support for victims of domestic violence
news.summary: An innovative creative project in the Czech Republic has been using a therapeutic theatre workshop to help homeless women who have been victims of domestic violence.

news.title: Aid to domestic violence victims
news.summary: Persefona is a NGO in the Czech Republic which provides comprehensive, free of charge long-term aid to people affected by domestic and sexual violence. With support from the EEA Grants, it has expanded its activities and reach.

news.title: Supporting NGOs to improve end-of-life care
news.summary: NGO 'Cesta domů' is working to ease the final choices of terminally ill people and their families in the Czech Republic and helping to make the subject of death less taboo.

news.title: Enhancing the lives of Roma through empowerment
news.summary: “In Iztok, up to 87% of the households live at or below the poverty line,” explains Sasho Kovachev, Chairperson of Bulgarian NGO Liberal Alternative for Roma Civil Unification (LARGO), illustrating the scale of marginalisation facing Roma communities.

news.title: The murder of Luka (18) made Croatians rise up against violence
news.summary: 18-year-old Luka Ritz was beaten up on his way home from a party in Zagreb. He died two days later. This is the story of how one boy’s death put violence on the agenda.

news.title: Dealing with bullying: How they made parents responsible
news.summary: Behind every bully are the parents. Should they be held accountable for their children’s bullying? An organisation in Croatia thinks so. Read how they attack the increasing problem of bullying.

news.title: Reducing stigma through acting
news.summary: Children with a parent in prison often face social stigma. With support from Iceland, Liechtenstein and Norway, Hungarian children of incarcerated parents now receive support aiming to overcome stigma and facilitate family contact.

news.title: Equal consumer rights for the visually impaired
news.summary: A Hungarian association for blind and visually impaired people has launched an initiative to help people with shopping: developing, introducing and implementing a classification system of blind friendly stores.

news.title: Strengthening civil society in Hungary
news.summary: The project ‘Glassvillage’ has increased the knowledge and awareness of NGOs, citizens, and local elected representatives of their rights to access and publish public information.

news.title: Countering hate violence in Hungary
news.summary: Supporting victims of hate crime and developing mechanism to deal with hate violence is at the centre of a project to counter hate violence in Hungary. The project is supported by Iceland, Liechtenstein and Norway through the NGO programme in Hungary.

news.title: Establishing a Civil House in Végegyháza
news.summary: Small NGOs often struggle with logistical resources and a lack of guidance, preventing them to reach their full potential. The Hungarian organisation Barangoló, has addressed this particular issue in Végegyháza by establishing a Civil House where NGOs can operate and receive support.

news.title: Improving data collection to fight corruption
news.summary: The Hungarian NGO K-Monitor is helping other NGOs in the country fight corruption by improving systems for sharing information and data.

news.title: The priceless checkpoint in Riga
news.summary: Every week approximately 30 people take an express HIV-test at the checkpoint run by the human rights organisation MOZAIKA. Five percent of the tests turns out to be positive.

news.title: ‘We’re Here’ - improving the lives of Latvian children with disabilities
news.summary: “The disabled children who enjoy our development programme become more open, enjoy learning and show good progress,” explains Andra Greitane, Director of the ‘Mes esam lidzas ’(We’re Here) Rehabilitation Centre.

news.title: Supporting Greek human rights NGOs
news.summary: “Most of the cases we deal with are about discrimination towards ethnic minorities in the workplace. We often see migrants being unpaid.”

news.title: Frontline protection for lone refugee children
news.summary: The plight of unaccompanied children has become one of the most pressing issues of the migrant crisis. At the frontline is Greek Humanitarian NGO, METAdrasi, providing critical care and protection through a network of guardians.

news.title: A breathing space for migrant children
news.summary: Over half a million refugees and migrants have reached Greece this year and the rate of arrivals is constantly rising. Amongst those, and with increasing frequency, are thousands of children and teenagers who arrive on their own.

news.title: Sharing responsibility for protecting wildlife
news.summary: Every year, millions of wild animals are killed on Europe’s roads. For every animal counted, many more die unnoticed. In Greece, the National Wildlife Observation Network is developing new ways to prevent wildlife from being run over to protect both biodiversity and drivers.

news.title: Guardians for unaccompanied migrant children
news.summary: “I drew a tree…I wrote his name in Greek and he wrote his name in Arabic. Ten minutes later we were laughing, he made fun of my accent in Arabic.”

news.title: Opening up a whole new world
news.summary: In today’s digital age, children have easy access to a variety of games online. However, not all children are that lucky. Few suitable options exist for children with visual impairments. The Greek project ‘LEAP’ aims to change that.

news.title: Empowering citizens through technology
news.summary: Located only a short walking distance from the historical Acropolis – the cradle of democracy – the Greek NGO SciFY is hard at work in strengthening citizen participation in modern-day Greek politics.

news.title: Breaking barriers through art
news.summary: In Greece, the Artability project is providing alternative therapy through art, music and dance for people with cerebral palsy. It also brings together people with and without disabilities and of all ages through a shared passion for creativity.

news.title: Picking up drop outs, delivering capable employees
news.summary: In an old cinema building outside Sofia, a youth centre has changed the life of many young Bulgarians. They’ve gone from drop-outs to proud citizens.

news.title: Empowering youth at risk in Bulgaria
news.summary: The International Youth Centre in Stara Zagora in Bulgaria has been awarded the Council of Europe’s Quality Label Award for its work on empowering young citizens in Bulgaria.

news.title: A good start for Roma children
news.summary: This week, a pre-school aimed at improving the quality of education received by Roma children was opened in the Bulgarian capital Sofia by the Norwegian Minister of EEA and EU Affairs, Elisabeth Aspaker.

news.title: Empowering Roma youth
news.summary: “I hope the youth centre will be a place where we can make new friends and learn new skills,” says Kostadin Chilikov. He is one of many young people that will benefit from four youth centres that have received grants in Bulgaria.

news.title: Better skills to meet the future
news.summary: In Cluj County, Romania, an EEA Grants project is helping young people with special needs build their skills in an innovative and supportive environment.

RO10.name: Children and Youth at Risk and Local and Regional Initiatives to Reduce National Inequalities and to Promote Social Inclusion

area: Local and regional initiatives to reduce national inequalities and to promote social inclusion

news.title: Building bridges by working together
news.summary: “For us, the need for a project like this is obvious. Blind children who are placed in special educational institutions are separated from other children – They need to have the opportunity to interact with their sighted peers.”

RO10.name: Children and Youth at Risk and Local and Regional Initiatives to Reduce National Inequalities and to Promote Social Inclusion

area: Local and regional initiatives to reduce national inequalities and to promote social inclusion

SK04.name: Local and Regional Initiatives to Reduce National Inequalities and to Promote Social Inclusion

area: Local and regional initiatives to reduce national inequalities and to promote social inclusion

PL06.name: Urban development by strengthening the competence of self-government units, social dialogue and cooperation with civil society representatives

area: Local and regional initiatives to reduce national inequalities and to promote social inclusion

CZ05.name: National, Regional, Local Initiatives to Reduce Inter-Group Inequalities and to Promote Social Inclusion

area: Local and regional initiatives to reduce national inequalities and to promote social inclusion
Local and regional initiatives to reduce national inequalities and to promote social inclusion

news.title: New initiative offers helping hand in Greece
news.summary: The EEA Grants featured recently in the Kathimerini English Edition - a daily newspaper published in Athens. Written by Ioanna Fotiadi, the article (reproduced below) tells the story of a support centre funded by the Grants soon to open in Athens.

GR08.name: Solidarity and Social Inclusion in Greece

news.title: The invisible parents
news.summary: “When a woman is told that there is something wrong with her baby, she tends to feel left out of the motherhood she had opened up to,” says psychologist Bogna Kędzierska. Read the story about how they approached the parents no one saw.

PL07.name: Development and better adaptation of health care to demographic and epidemiological trends

news.title: The fight against unhealthy eating habits
news.summary: “The structure of the modern society is one of the main reasons behind unhealthy eating habits. Because we don’t prioritise food in a stressful everyday life, we often eat food that don't give us the sufficient amount of energy we need. The biggest problem in Portugal is the lack of knowledge related to food."

news.title: Teaming up for better health
news.summary: A new national health examination survey - the first of its kind in Portugal - supported through the EEA Grants will contribute to a more comprehensive understanding of Portuguese health.

area: Mainstreaming gender equality and promoting work-life balance

PT07.name: Mainstreaming Gender Equality and Promoting Work-Life Balance

area: Mainstreaming gender equality and promoting work-life balance

RO11.name: Mainstreaming Gender Equality and Promoting Work-Life Balance

area: Mainstreaming gender equality and promoting work-life balance

news.title: Changing women’s role in the Spanish society
news.summary: "'Promociona' helped me feel more confident as a leader. I believe in myself after they gave me coaching and mentoring. I used to be more insecure and humble as a female leader."

news.title: Women mean business: 190 success stories
news.summary: Lourdes, Soledad, Eva and Carolina: four women, four different backgrounds, each with a different story to tell. But they have one thing in common. All have ventured out of their comfort zone and taken the brave step of setting up their own business.

news.title: Education to end stereotypes
news.summary: Gender stereotypes negatively affect society as a whole. In Spain, a project supported by the Grants aims to contribute to a more equal society by challenging gender inequality through the school system.

area: Institutional framework in the asylum and migration sector

news.title: Funding lifeline for Greek asylum service
news.summary: “Looking after these people, giving them protection, it’s an investment for the future. It’s a gain not a loss. That’s how I see it. It’s a small thing for me to give but it’s a big thing for those we’re helping.”

GR05.name: Address urgent needs for the reception and screening of new arrivals and for the accommodation of vulnerable groups. Assistance to voluntary returns.

GR06.name: Capacity building of national asylum and migration management systems

area: Conservation and revitalisation of cultural and natural heritage

news.title: Restored manor school open for business
news.summary: Dating back to the 18th century, Aruküla Manor is one of many manor houses in Estonia that had seen better days. Now, thanks to an EEA Grants-funded renovation, the building has been restored to its former glory.

EE05.name: Conservation and Revitalisation of Cultural and Natural Heritage

area: Conservation and revitalisation of cultural and natural heritage

HU07.name: Conservation and Revitalisation of Cultural Heritage and Natural Heritage

area: Conservation and revitalisation of cultural and natural heritage

news.title: Conserving Jewish cultural heritage in Latvia
news.summary: With help from Norwegian construction students, one of the oldest wooden synagogues in the Baltics has been restored. When the ‘Green Synagogue’ opened to the public it was barely recognisable.

LV04.name: Conservation and Revitalisation of Cultural and Natural Heritage

area: Conservation and revitalisation of cultural and natural heritage

news.title: Bringing ancient history to light: A crosscultural treasure hunt
news.summary: In the centre of Sofia in Bulgaria, ancient ruins are being uncovered by a team of archaeologists. Through exhibition kiosks and quizzes on the digging sites, the goal is to make the inhabitants of Sofia curious about their history.

area: Conservation and revitalisation of cultural and natural heritage

news.title: Banned books reveal new secrets
news.summary: When librarians started opening the books confiscated by Nazis during the Second World War, they found hidden stories.

area: Conservation and revitalisation of cultural and natural heritage

news.title: Culture centre in Cyprus building a common future
news.summary: Today it is the UN-controlled buffer zone that divides the Greek-Cypriots and Turkish-Cypriots.  Hundred years ago, it was the colour of their clothing. Through funding from Iceland, Liechtenstein and Norway, the Centre for Visual Arts and Research in Nicosia documents how the two groups lived peacefully together for hundreds of years.

area: Conservation and revitalisation of cultural and natural heritage

ES05.name: Conservation  and  Revitalisation  of  Cultural  and  Natural  Heritage

area: Conservation and revitalisation of cultural and natural heritage

SK05.name: Conservation and Revitalisation of Cultural and Natural Heritage & Promotion of Diversity in Culture and Arts within European Cultural Heritage

area: Conservation and revitalisation of cultural and natural heritage

news.title: The river that hides a thousand secrets
news.summary: A river winds its way through Ljubljana and the surrounding villages. A river that hides Slovenia’s most threatened cultural heritage. Now thousand-year-old jewelry, swords, pitchers and boats are being laboriously hauled out of the river mud, restored and exhibited.

news.title: First car-free nature park in Slovenia
news.summary: Inspired by Jotunheimen Nature Park in Norway - which has a very restrictive policy on the use of motorised vehicles - Sečovlje Nature Park will become the first Slovenian nature park where cars are banned.

area: Conservation and revitalisation of cultural and natural heritage

RO12.name: Conservation and Revitalisation of Cultural and Natural Heritage

area: Conservation and revitalisation of cultural and natural heritage

PT08.name: Conservation and Revitalisation of Cultural and Natural Heritage

area: Conservation and revitalisation of cultural and natural heritage

news.title: Learning about maritime cultural heritage
news.summary: With its grand opening earlier this year, the new branch of the National Maritime Museum in Gdansk in Poland – the Shipwreck Conservation Centre in Tczew – has ensured access to maritime cultural heritage for generations to come.

news.title: In Warsaw, increasing access to the Jewish cultural heritage
news.summary: More than 3 million people have benefitted from the Jewish cultural heritage project at POLIN, the Museum of the History of Polish Jews in Warsaw. The project was developed in close cooperation between Polish and Norwegian cultural players.

PL08.name: Conservation and Revitalisation of Cultural and Natural Heritage

area: Conservation and revitalisation of cultural and natural heritage

news.title: Ensuring continued access to world heritage in Malta
news.summary: “The project will ensure long-term preservation and protection of the site and continued access for the public in the years to come.”

area: Conservation and revitalisation of cultural and natural heritage

LT06.name: Conservation and Revitalisation of Cultural and Natural Heritage

area: Promotion of diversity in culture and arts within European cultural heritage

news.title: Hidden art treasures in Lithuania
news.summary: In a hundred years old water reservoir ­ – hidden from the eyes of the passers-by – an art exhibition is taking place. Presenting the works of several Norwegian and Lithuanian artists, the exhibition is called ‘Climbing invisible structures. Ritualized Disciplinary Practices in Social Life’.

LT07.name: Promotion of Diversity in Culture and Arts within European Cultural Heritage

area: Promotion of diversity in culture and arts within European cultural heritage

news.title: Connecting through photography
news.summary: With Iceland in the spotlight, the Warsaw Art Photography Festival 2015 brings Polish and Icelandic photographers together under the theme of ‘common space’.

PL09.name: Promotion of Diversity in Culture and Arts within European Cultural Heritage (Donor Partnership Programme)

area: Promotion of diversity in culture and arts within European cultural heritage

news.title: Directed by toddlers
news.summary: What happens when you let toddlers loose in a theatre play? Portugal and Norway are about to find out.

area: Promotion of diversity in culture and arts within European cultural heritage

RO13.name: Promotion of Diversity in Culture and Arts within European Cultural Heritage

area: Promotion of diversity in culture and arts within European cultural heritage

SK05.name: Conservation and Revitalisation of Cultural and Natural Heritage & Promotion of Diversity in Culture and Arts within European Cultural Heritage

area: Promotion of diversity in culture and arts within European cultural heritage

news.title: No filter
news.summary: “The first time I saw my self-portrait I cried and felt ugly, I looked very vulnerable,” the former inmate Kristine says.

news.title: “I needed to show sadness”
news.summary: “I wanted to die in this picture, but at the same time I didn’t. I needed to show sadness, loneliness and impotence, because I was trapped behind these wall,” says the inmate Noé (41) who participated in the art therapy project ‘Her/Story’.

area: Promotion of diversity in culture and arts within European cultural heritage
Promotion of diversity in culture and arts within European cultural heritage
Promotion of diversity in culture and arts within European cultural heritage

LV04.name: Conservation and Revitalisation of Cultural and Natural Heritage

area: Promotion of diversity in culture and arts within European cultural heritage

HU07.name: Conservation and Revitalisation of Cultural Heritage and Natural Heritage

news.title: Studying the past to benefit the future
news.summary: Together, the Babes-Bolyai University in Cluj-Napoca, Romania and the Norwegian Historical Data Centre at the Arctic University of Norway (UiT) are building the first historical population database of Transylvania.

news.title: Telling the stories of Roma
news.summary: In Romania, a project funded by Iceland, Liechtenstein and Norway through the Romanian ‘Research Cooperation’ programme, aims to raise awareness of cultural identities by documenting the oral history of Roma.

news.title: Technology for better health
news.summary: Levelling up and unlocking missions – a project supported through the Research programme in Romania seeks an alternative approach to fighting depression.

news.title: Cheaper solar cells with nanotechnology
news.summary: A joint Spanish-Norwegian research project aiming to use nanotechnology in developing cost-effective materials for use in solar cells and batteries has laid the foundation for future cooperation between Spanish and Norwegian researchers.

news.title: Better quality of life for wheelchair users
news.summary: What does your gym do to adapt their facilities to help wheelchair users to take part in activities? Physiotherapy student Łukasz Kozłowski from Poland and Ásta Jónsdóttir from Iceland tried to move around in wheelchairs one day to better understand the challenges.

PL10.name: EEA Scholarship Programme; Norwegian-Polish Scholarship Programme

news.title: Introducing green thinking in vocational training
news.summary: In Estonia, Norwegian and Estonian schools are working together to make environmental thinking an indispensable part of vocational education.

CZ07.name: EEA Scholarship Programme; Bilateral Scholarship Programme

CZ08.name: Pilot studies and surveys on CCS technology

news.title: Norwegian-Bulgarian cooperation contributes to more efficient production
news.summary: Together with Norwegian partners, InterConsult Bulgaria (ICB) has developed a system that monitors the maintenance of industrial machines in a more cost-effective way.

news.title: Boosting competitiveness and creating jobs
news.summary: With support from Norway, the Bulgarian furniture producer Valiyan has invested in new machinery contributing to increased production capacity, creation of jobs as well as reduction of energy consumption, waste and emissions.

news.title: Prisoners producing solar panels
news.summary: In Sofia prison in Bulgaria’s capital a new green production facility is set up. The prisoners now get valuable training producing solar panel collectors and water heaters.

news.title: How a small Estonian bus station revolutionised the European way of travelling
news.summary: Almost by chance the IT-department of a bus station in Estonia found the answer. Now their e-solution is a best-in-class experience for passengers not only in Europe, but it is conquering global markets.

news.title: Being green is good business
news.summary: The big yellow machine is eating its way through polluted layers of offshore waste, breaking down hazardous substances, and spitting out clean soil.

news.title: Green business for a greener environment
news.summary: “We’re focusing on quality, safety and good equipment. This project allows us to invest in our own factory, reduce energy costs and offer our employees a better working environment.”

news.title: Norwegian technology makes Romanian agritourism greener
news.summary: In the Romanian countryside, sewage is often discharged directly into rivers and lakes. This is one of the greatest environmental challenges in Romania today. Norwegian technology is an important part of the solution.

news.title: Creating jobs and improving the environment
news.summary: Romania has the lowest recycling rate in the EU. Less than three per cent of the waste is recycled. Supported by Norway, waste collections points are now set up across the country.

news.title: Working to improve social dialogue in Croatia
news.summary: “The project has helped raise awareness of the importance of tripartite social dialogue at both regional and national level, and the necessity of active social partners in developing public policy.”

news.title: Did you know that tap water can contain other people’s medication?
news.summary: Czech researchers found 45 different types of medicines in samples from a river that will be turned into drinking water for the Prague region. Together with Norwegian scientists, they now search for methods to keep the drugs out of your drinking water.

news.title: Can your healthy breakfast get even healthier?
news.summary: Latvian and Norwegian researchers are working together to explore the health benefits of hull-less cereals.

news.title: Making a difference through research cooperation
news.summary: “There are many sad stories of people with little or no income that still get credit. This is a huge social problem, and it needs to be addressed,” says Karin Sein, Associate Professor at the Faculty of Law at the University of Tartu.

news.title: Research reduces noise pollution
news.summary: With support from Norway, Gdansk Technical University in Poland and the Norwegian Foundation for Scientific and Industrial Research (SINTEF) have worked together to reduce noise pollution from older vehicles.

news.title: Exploring climate change and the Arctic
news.summary: What effect does climate change have on the Arctic ecosystem? With support from Norway, Polish and Norwegian researchers have joined forces to develop a better understanding of the implications of ocean warming.

PL10.name: EEA Scholarship Programme; Norwegian-Polish Scholarship Programme

news.title: Rolling into the Czech labour market
news.summary: The message to Czech employers is quite obvious: It’s not your head that’s not working if you’re sitting in a wheelchair, it’s your legs.

CZ07.name: EEA Scholarship Programme; Bilateral Scholarship Programme

area: Capacity-building and institutional cooperation between beneficiary state and Norwegian public institutions, local and regional authorities

news.title: Together against corruption
news.summary: "Corruption ultimately affects the entire economy and is one of the causes of demoralization of society. It is a problem for many public and private institutions, and hence we need to combat it decisively and in a coordinated manner."

CZ10.name: Capacity-building and Institutional Cooperation between Benificiary State and Norwegian Public Institutions, Local and Regional Authorities

area: Capacity-building and institutional cooperation between beneficiary state and Norwegian public institutions, local and regional authorities
Capacity-building and institutional cooperation between beneficiary state and Norwegian public institutions, local and regional authorities

news.title: Modernised governance for local authorities
news.summary: Latvian municipalities deliver many services to the public but they have tight budgetary constraints. Norway has developed a ‘smart’ governance approach which is being used as a model in Latvia.

news.title: Smart governance for Latvian local authorities
news.summary: “This project will stimulate local government to take more initiative, improve their work and achieve a more efficient use of the resources,”explains Andris Jaunsleinis, Chairman of the Latvian Association of Local and Regional Governments.

LV07.name: Capacity-Building and Institutional Cooperation between Latvian and Norwegian Public Institutions, Local and Regional Authorities

area: Capacity-building and institutional cooperation between beneficiary state and Norwegian public institutions, local and regional authorities

HU11.name: Capacity-Building and Institutional Cooperation between Beneficiary State and Norwegian Public Institutions, Local and Regional Authorities

Capacity-building and institutional cooperation between beneficiary state and Norwegian public institutions, local and regional authorities

LT10.name: Capacity-Building and Institutional Cooperation between Beneficiary State and Norwegian Public Institutions, Local and Regional Authorities

news.title: Recognising and treating victims of domestic violence in Slovenia
news.summary: With support through the Norway Grants, Slovenian and Norwegian organisations are working together to improve the skills of health care professionals in recognising and responding to domestic violence.

news.title: International Roma Day: Improving access to basic health services
news.summary: The living conditions which most Roma face often have serious consequences for their health. On the occasion of International Roma Day, we take a look at a Romanian initiative aiming to facilitate access to basic health services for the Roma.

news.title: World Tuberculosis Day: Saving lives by increasing TB knowledge
news.summary: Tuberculosis represents a major public health treat in Romania. LHL International from Norway is involved as a partner in a Romanian project aiming to strengthen TB control.

news.title: Saving lives through check-ups
news.summary: With support through the Grants, Romania and Norway are pulling their forces together in the fight against cancer.

PL07.name: Development and better adaptation of health care to demographic and epidemiological trends

news.title: How a website made young Estonians talk about sex
news.summary: How do I know if I’m pregnant? Is this the right size? With 40 counsellors and 1500 unique questions annually, a web based counselling clinic breaks taboos in Estonia.

news.title: “I need to get my life on track”
news.summary: “I struggle with panic attacks, and here I am surrounded by medical staff that knows how to act. I need to get back on track.” These are the words of 14-year-old Kathriin, one of the patients at the new Children’s mental health centre in Estonia.

news.title: Jana’s story: improving social inclusion in the Czech Republic
news.summary: When Jana got sick, she could no longer work in the kindergarten. Other jobs she tried were too stressful. When she got a job at the café Blue House, her life improved.

news.title: When puppets hit the road
news.summary: It’s a hard job but four puppets have taken it upon themselves. Through 28 shows they hope to prevent child accidents in a country where the numbers are deeply worrying.

area: Mainstreaming gender equality and promoting work-life balance

CZ12.name: Mainstreaming Gender Equality and Promoting Work-Life Balance & Domestic and Gender-based Violence; Let’s give (wo)men a chance

CZ13.name: Domestic and Gender-based Violence & Mainstreaming Gender Equality and Promoting Work-Life Balance

area: Mainstreaming gender equality and promoting work-life balance

news.title: Putting gender equality on the agenda in Estonian schools
news.summary: The influence of education in the process of creating a more equal society is undisputed. With support from the Norway Grants, gender equality has been put on the agenda in Estonian schools.

EE09.name: Mainstreaming Gender Equality and Promoting Work-Life Balance

area: Mainstreaming gender equality and promoting work-life balance

news.title: More women in politics
news.summary: Despite some progress, women in Slovenia continue to be under-represented in politics and business. With funding from Norway, the ‘OPENN’ project is working to identify the barriers that hinder greater female participation.

news.title: Providing help to victims of domestic violence
news.summary: Thanks to funding from Norway, a Polish NGO is providing help to women who have been victims of domestic violence.

news.title: Helping Estonian victims of domestic and gender-based violence
news.summary: “Now, I receive legal help and therapy. I want to get my life back, and to study at the university,” says Mari (not her real name), an Estonian victim of domestic violence.

news.title: Working together to prevent domestic violence
news.summary: Two NGOs – one Czech and one Norwegian – have joined forces to share experience and know-how in domestic violence prevention. The project has received support from the Norway Grants.

CZ12.name: Mainstreaming Gender Equality and Promoting Work-Life Balance & Domestic and Gender-based Violence; Let’s give (wo)men a chance

CZ13.name: Domestic and Gender-based Violence & Mainstreaming Gender Equality and Promoting Work-Life Balance

news.title: Better support for victims of domestic violence
news.summary: Until now, the shelter capacity for victims of domestic violence in Cyprus has been low. When SPAVO House opened in September, it became Cyprus’ first purpose-built shelter to support victims of violence.

area: Schengen cooperation and combating cross-border and organised crime, including trafficking and itinerant criminal groups

news.title: The Police: Our mind-set and attitudes towards the Roma has changed
news.summary: Making the police more knowledgeable about the Roma communities they are working in, is helping Bulgarian police officers treat the Roma differently and better enable them to deal with their problems.

BG13.name: Schengen Cooperation and Combating Cross-border and Organised Crime, including Trafficking and Itinerant Criminal Groups

area: Schengen cooperation and combating cross-border and organised crime, including trafficking and itinerant criminal groups

CZ14.name: Schengen Cooperation and Combating Cross-border and Organised Crime, including Trafficking and Itinerant Criminal Groups

area: Schengen cooperation and combating cross-border and organised crime, including trafficking and itinerant criminal groups

news.title: The border guards' main weapon is their knowledge
news.summary: Language skills and multicultural competence are among the Polish border guards most efficient tools.

PL15.name: Schengen Cooperation and Combating Cross-border and Organised Crime, including Trafficking and Itinerant Criminal Groups

area: Schengen cooperation and combating cross-border and organised crime, including trafficking and itinerant criminal groups

LT13.name: Efficiency, quality and transparency in Lithuanian courts

PL16.name: Judicial Capacity Building and Cooperation/Improvement of the efficiency of justice

CZ15.name: Judicial Capacity-building Cooperation and Correctional Services, including Non-custodial Sanctions

news.title: Improving access to justice in Bulgaria
news.summary: Two regional legal aid centres and a national telephone hotline offering legal advice to people in difficult situations are established as new services in Bulgaria. These services have been so successful that they will now be continued and expanded.

BG14.name: Judicial Capacity-building and Cooperation/Improvement of the efficiency of justice

news.title: Building trust with a new court house
news.summary: Thousands of neglected cases, too few judges and complaints about corruption have given Croatia’s courts a bad reputation. A new court house, a new filing system and training of staff can make a difference.

news.title: We have everything we need except for freedom
news.summary: Many inmates enter Bulgaria’s only women prison with severe health problems. As a result of a reconstruction process, they can now get the health care they need behind prison walls.

CZ15.name: Judicial Capacity-building Cooperation and Correctional Services, including Non-custodial Sanctions

news.title: Introducing alternatives to imprisonment
news.summary: With support from Norwegian partners, the Latvian Probation Service are exploring alternatives to prison that can contribute to successful rehabilitation and lower the number of prisoners in Latvian prisons.

news.title: Official opening of Olaine Prison's new unit for drug addicts
news.summary: In the beginning of October, a new rehabilitation and treatment centre for drug addicts was officially opened at Olaine Prison in Riga. The construction of the new unit is an important first initiative to fight drug dependency in Latvian prisons.

news.title: A new shift in the Latvian prison system
news.summary: With support from Norway, Latvian authorities are working to improve drug prevention and treatment programmes in the Latvian prison system. Norwegian partners have shared knowledge and expertise on drug re-socialisation programmes.

LV08.name: Reform of the Latvian Correctional services and police Detention Centres

news.title: Children serving time with their mothers
news.summary: This is much better than the closed prison. My daughter is not afraid of people anymore,” says Ramona (31), a Lithuanian inmate in the newly established prison-house for female offenders raising children while serving time.

news.title: A way back to society
news.summary: “I need to be re-integrated before getting out of prison. During the past years I have lost my connection to society, I don’t know the new laws, and I need to establish relations with my family again.”

news.title: Establishing a more humane prison
news.summary: Inspired by the renowned Bastøy Prison in Norway, Romanian authorities have established their own human ecological prison along the same lines. The Norwegian Correctional Services have provided knowledge and best practices.

PL08.name: Conservation and Revitalisation of Cultural and Natural Heritage

area: Local and regional initiatives to reduce national inequalities and to promote social inclusion

news.title: Together against poverty
news.summary: Supported through the Norway Grants, two new community centres in Iasi and Ploiesti in Romania work to provide vulnerable families with better access to basic services in education, health and social protection, including an after-school programme.

PL04.name: Saving energy and promoting renewable energy source
